summary:
Learning more about your local area can help better connect you to where you live.  Here are some ways to spark that. 
The post Five ways to explore where you live appeared first on rscottjones...
title: Five ways to explore where you live

summary: The journey of our Madrid Founders in a new country is as personal as it is professional.  Read their stories that highlight the emotional and practical challenges of adapting to new cultural environments
title: Madrid update: Our first weeks as Founders

summary:
Over the summer, I gave a talk about AI and democracy at TedXBillings.  The recording is live. 
Please share...
title: My TedXBillings Talk

summary: 13 things I love about my dachshund, Cocoa for her 13th birthday
title: Cocoa turns 13 today

summary: As software developers, we're always learning new things; it's practically the whole gig.  If we can learn to quickly pick up new languages/frameworks/tools, we'll become so much more effective at our job.  It's sort of a superpower
title: How To Learn Stuff Quickly

summary: Large language models like GPT-4 are becoming increasingly capable, at an alarming rate.  Within a couple of years, we won't need developers any more.  â€¦Or at least, that's the narrative going viral on Twitter...
title: The End of Front-End Development

summary: CSS variables are *really* cool, and they're incredibly powerful when it comes to React.  This tutorial shows how we can use them with React to create dynamic themes.  We'll see how to get the most out of CSS-in-JS tools like styled-components, and how our mental frame around media queries has been wrong all along
title: CSS Variables for React Devs

summary: I have a set of baseline CSS styles that come with me from project to project.  In the past, I'd use a typical CSS reset, but times have changed, and I believe I have a better set of global styles
title: A Modern CSS Reset

summary: In this post, we'll explore a technique we can use to "fold" a DOM node, like folding a letter in real-life.  On that journey, we'll learn a lot about 3D transforms and CSS animation techniques
title: Folding the DOM

summary: In our community, it's so common for developer projects to be open-source.  I'm breaking with this trend for my blog, but I have good reasons.  In this article, I'll share my reasoning, as well as a workaround in case you _really_ want to see the source...
title: Why My Blog is Closed-Source
